welcome.title: Welcome to SEObserver
welcome.content: The 2 pillars of SEObserver are the analysis of SERPs, thanks to the SERPmachine, and backlinks analysis.

serpmachine.title: SERPmachine
serpmachine.content: The SERPmachine allows you to quickly identify changes in the SERP for a given keyword.

keywordHistory.title: Keyword History
keywordHistory.content: Enter a keyword in this field to display the position history between two dates in the SERPmachine.

research.title: Research
research.content: You can access the SERPmachine directly from here, and it does not matter what page you are on on SEObserver.

analyzeWebsite.title: Analyze a Website
analyzeWebsite.content: You have the option to enter a URL address to analyze a website instantly, you will have access to its identity card.

lastLinks.noLinksDescription: Add sites to your watchlist to start tracking backlinks history.

tooltips.googleGlobalIndex: Number of pages in Google's index.
tooltips.majesticIndexedPages: Shows the number of pages crawled by the Majestic robot. This should preferably be consistent with the number of pages indexed by Google.
tooltips.alexaRank: Traffic indicator. The lower this number, the higher the traffic.

anchorTextPanel.title: Anchor
anchorTextPanel.tooltip: Provides a breakdown of the top 10 anchors used in backlinks. Too many optimized keywords can indicate a risk of a penguin penalty.

historicalMetricsPanel.title: Historical Metrics
historicalMetricsPanel.error: Unable to load historical data. Please try again later.

historicalTable.title: Historical Data Table
historicalTable.error: Error loading historical data. Please try again.

tooltips.referringDomains: A notoriety indicator that shows how many different unique domains are linking to the target site. This data is essential and allows you to know if the site is mentioned on many different domains.
tooltips.referringPages: A nature indicator that indicates the number of times a link has been found on a page of another website. Allows you to see if there is a strong presence of "sitewide" links: a link present on 100 pages will increase this number by 100.
tooltips.ipSubnets: A reputation indicator that indicates the number of different IPs linking to the site. Consistency between the number of referring domains and the number of IPs makes it possible to verify that the sites are different and do not belong to a network.
tooltips.eduGovLinks: EDU Links: Counts the number of "academic" type links in backlinks. GOV Links: Counts the number of "government" type links in backlinks.

keywordRankingsPanel.error: Error loading keyword rankings. Please try again.
keywordRankingsPanel.noData: No keyword rankings found for this domain.
keywordRankingsPanel.title: Top 5 Keywords

tooltips.trustFlow: TrustFlow: Majestic's trust indicator, from 0 to 100, measuring the "juice" sent, directly and indirectly, from a list of 1 million manually selected trusted sites. The notion of "trust" is an integral part of this indicator, which is highly qualified and considered to be the most faithful to Pagerank.
tooltips.citationFlow: CitationFlow: A Majestic power indicator ranging from 0 to 100 that measures the raw "juice" sent from sites across the entire web. This metric doesn't take into account the concept of "trust," and knowing it is primarily used to assess raw power. A low-quality netlinking campaign will increase Citation Flow but not Trust Flow.
tooltips.topicalTrustFlow: Checks links consistency. This index is used to show what type of sites high-quality links are coming from. This adds "theme" data to Trust Flow by categorizing the content of the websites that link. You should focus on getting links preferably from the same theme.
